title: Australia's best paid bureaucrat rakes in $2.5m
text:
The figures, provided to Parliament this week, include Mr Neal's base salary of $648,591 and more than $770,000 in performance bonuses.

Mr Arndt took home $664,832 in base salary and more than $759,000 in bonuses.

Future Fund chairman Peter Costello, who chairs Nine Entertainment which owns The Australian Financial Review, received $230,417 in remuneration.

The fund's performance compares favourably to the top superannuation funds over the financial year, delivering a strong annual return of 11.5 per cent as its assets swelled. It has now earned more than $100 billion in investment returns since being created in May 2006.

Future Fund manager David Neal earned more than the RBA governor. Wayne Taylor

Reserve Bank governor Philip Lowe, who has encouraged private sector wage growth and called for a 3 per cent pay increase for federal public servants, received $1.059 million last financial year.

The total included $911,728 in base salary, super and long service leave entitlements and $8,100 in other benefits and allowances.

As head of the Reserve Bank, Dr Lowe is responsible for managing a $182 billion balance sheet.

Advertisement

Last month he hit out at corporate pay, saying executives should be happy to delivery value to firms without receiving $20 million.

ABC managing director David Anderson received $1.4 million, including a base salary of $799,136 and long-service leave benefits of $265,933.

The public broadcaster's bill for senior salaries blew out to about $6 million due to payments to sacked boss Michelle Guthrie.

ASIC's new enforcment boss Daniel Crenan, QC, took home $684,363.

James Taylor, the managing director of SBS, received total remuneration of $809,113.

Australian Securities and Investments Commission James Shipton received total remuneration of $801,866, including a base salary of $758,535

His high profile deputy chairman, Daniel Crenan, QC, took home $684,363, including a base salary of $588,433.

After moving from Treasury to lead Prime Minister Scott Morrison's department, Phil Gaetjens salary will be more than $914,460. His salary at Treasury was $879,978.

Advertisement

The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade annual report listed secretary Frances Adamson's total remuneration at $936,442. Tax Commissioner Chris Jordan took home $838,357, including a base salary of $758,005.

Finance Department secretary Rosemary Huxtable received $821, 438, including a base salary of $686,500 and $106,00 in super contributions.

Chief of Defence Angus Campbell took home more than Defence Department boss Greg Moriarty last financial year. General Campbell received $1.024 million, including superannuation contributions of more than $214,000.

Mr Moriarty — a former chief of staff to Malcolm Turnbull and ambassador to Indonesia and Iran — took home $886,145.

Outgoing Australian Bureau of Statistics boss David Kalish received $841,720, including a base salary of $532,000.

This week he warned the ABS would have to start cutting its key economic and population reports without better budget funding, potentially leaving the government and Reserve Bank in the dark.

National Gallery of Australia chief Nick Mitzevich, appointed in April 2018, received total remuneration of $601,000 in 2018-19, including $71,000 in performance bonuses.

A pay increase for federal MPs in July means Prime Minister Scott Morrison received a bump of just over $10,000, on top of his existing $538,460 pay packet.
description: A stellar performance by the $198.8 billion Future Fund has driven up the pay packets of its key stewards.
